text: Pope Innocent XI (; 16 May 1611 â€“ 12 August 1689), born Benedetto Odescalchi, was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church and the 240th Pope from 1676 to 1689. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-12-1. ==Early life== Benedetto Odescalchi was born at Como in 1611."Blessed Pope Innocent XI", Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-12-1. He was the son of a Como nobleman, Livio Odescalchi ==Cardinal== In 1645, Pope Innocent X raised Odescalchi to the rank of cardinal. ==Bishop== In 1650, Odescalchi became Bishop of Novara. ==Pope== Cardinal Odescalchi was elected pope on 21 September 1676; and he chose to be called Innocent XI. Pope Innocent was involved in Italian and European political disputes, chiefly with Louis XIV of France In December 1688, Innocent received the diplomatic mission sent to the Vatican by Narai, the King of Siam.Smithies, Michael and Luigi Bressan. (2001). Siam and the Vatican in the Seventeenth Century, p. 98. ===After his death=== After Innocent XI in 1689, he was buried in St. Peter's Basilica. The process of canonization was begun in 1714 and suspended in 1744.
